intro: Prosthechea campos-portoi, commonly known as the Campos-Portoi orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments, relying on atmospheric moisture for nourishment. Its leaves are usually ovate and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This orchid is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its ecological niche.
